intro: Chlorophytum mamillatum, commonly known as the tiger tooth plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, striped leaves that resemble tiger teeth. The plant produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers that appear in clusters during the summer months. It is a hardy, low-maintenance plant that thrives in well-drained soil and bright, indirect light. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for both indoor and outdoor gardening.
